To ensure a smooth transition, please note the following important dates:
As of the date of this notice, we will no longer accept new credit card applications.
Effective July 15, 2024, all credit card functions will be suspended.

We kindly request that you withdraw any remaining balance in your credit card account by July 15, 2024.
If you miss the withdraw deadline, please contact our customer service for assistance.

We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience caused by this decision and thank you for your understanding and cooperation during this time.

HopeCard Team

Dear Cardholder,
Thank you for your continued support and trust in our crypto credit card services. Due to evolving market conditions, we regret to inform you that we will be discontinuing our credit card services effective July 15, 2024.

#Hope #HopeCard #HOPETheLightBeWithYou
Additionally, special thanks to @BlockSecTeam  for providing crucial information during the tracking process.

On October 18th, the HopeLend protocol suffered a hacker attack. The https://t.co/ZWG5YU1czO team immediately assembled an emergency response task force composed of both internal and external security experts and team members, doing their utmost to protect users' assets.

Through relentless efforts, a frontrunner from Armor Team voluntarily returned the acquired assets. This spirit of cooperation fills us with hope. The https://t.co/ZWG5YU1czO team will continue to follow up and address all aspects of this incident.

Following the incident, our cryptocurrency community and supporters of the https://t.co/ZWG5YU1czO ecosystem stood behind us. The close collaboration and trust of everyone has been instrumental in quickly resolving the issue.

We also want to extend special thanks to SlowMist @SlowMist_Team , BlockSec @BlockSecTeam , and Bitrace (https://t.co/X7WVBY1qcs) for their expertise and assistance, which helped us take prompt action.

Transparency and a secure ecosystem have always been the top priorities for https://t.co/ZWG5YU1czO. We feel honored to have such a strong and caring community. 

In the future, https://t.co/ZWG5YU1czO will continue to march forward with determination, striving to build a more secure, stable, and powerful cryptocurrency ecosystem. Once again, thank you for your support and trust.

On October 18, 2023, at 11:48:59 AM +UTC, the HopeLend protocol fell victim to a hacker attack. It is important to note that the hacker did not profit from this attack.

The attack resulted in a loss of approximately 528 ETH, out of which 263.91 ETH were bribed by the frontrunner to a Validator (managed by Lido). The exploit frontrunner eventually profited by 264.08 ETH. 

Currently, we are actively reaching out to the parties involved and recovering the related assets.

It is crucial to emphasize that all protocols deployed on https://t.co/ZWG5YU1czO are independent and will not impact the various other products and protocols currently live on the platform, including HopeCard„ÄÅHopeSwap and $HOPE. We are committed to ensuring the protection of the affected users' rights, and the corresponding funds remain secure.

We sincerely appreciate the continued support and trust from the Hope community. We will provide updates as information becomes available.

RT @metromxyz: Our backend faced the ultimate test: 100 campaigns simultaneously on the busiest @Uniswap v3 pools.

Key Takeaways
‚Ä¢ Scalability: The backend comfortably handled 100 simultaneous campaigns on DeFi's busiest pools, showcasing the potential to easily manage over 200 campaigns in production.

‚Ä¢ Efficiency: Despite the stress test being far more demanding than typical production scenarios, the backend maintained stable performance.

‚Ä¢ Reliability: Handled large data volumes with only one minor error due to large upserted data volumes, which was easily resolved.

Metrom is ready for the next phase.

Our Initial Test (The warm up)
Objective:
To evaluate our backend performance under high transaction volumes.

Setup:
‚Ä¢ Campaigns Created: 50
‚Ä¢ Pool: USDC/WETH on @Uniswap v3 - @arbitrum
‚Ä¢ Reward: 1000 USDC per campaign
‚Ä¢ Monitoring: CPU and memory usage, campaign initialization, reward assignment, @IPFS storage, Merkle tree generation, and push on-chain

Results:
‚Ä¢ Memory usage: peaked at 50MB
‚Ä¢ CPU usage: negligible
‚Ä¢ Database size: approximately 40MB
‚Ä¢ Performance: smooth operations with update fetching intervals of 4-5 hours per run

Advanced Test (Big daddy)
Objective:
To push our backend beyond typical production scenarios.

Setup:
‚Ä¢ Campaigns created: 100 highly active pools
‚Ä¢ Pools: USDC/ETH, bUSDC/ETH, ARB/USDC on @Uniswap v3 - @arbitrum
‚Ä¢ Changes: Staggered start/end dates to simulate real-world conditions

Challenges:
‚Ä¢ Error encountered: database interaction issue due to large upserted data volumes
‚Ä¢ Solution: implemented chunking for upsert operations

Results:
‚Ä¢ Memory usage: peaked at 90MB post-patch
‚Ä¢ CPU usage: remained negligible
‚Ä¢ Observation: Subgraph data fetching was a bottleneck; expected to improve in production with paid subgraph usage

Next Steps
With successful tests completed, our next move is a private backend audit by @HatsFinance.

This vital step will confirm our platform's security and reliability, ensuring an unmatched experience for our partners.

Stay tuned for more updates as we inch closer to launch!

GYD/USDC.e on zkEVM
GYD/USDT on zkEVM
GYD/USDC on Mainnet
GYD/USDT on Mainnet
GYD/sDAI on Mainnet

SPINs are split up among voters in each pool proportionally to the number of votes (but at most 6 SPIN per vote). SPIN rewards only take effect for pools that clear the 0.1% vlAURA threshold.
